uk.ac.open.kmi.iserve.sal.manager

Interface RegistryManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RegistryManagerImpl

    public interface RegistryManager
    iServe Manager provides the main entry point to the entire Storage and Access Layer of a given registry.
    Since:
    17/10/2013
    Author:
    Carlos Pedrinaci (KMi - The Open University)

    • Method Detail

      • registerAsObserver

        void registerAsObserver(Object obj)
        Register the given object as an Observer for this iServe instance. All events created within iServe would be notified. Currently based on Guava's EventBus. In order to process them, the corresponding observer should only implement a method that takes as sole parameter the event wanted to process. This method should additionally be annotated with @Subscribe for the system to work.
        Parameters:
        obj - The observer

      • unregisterObserver

        void unregisterObserver(Object obj)
        Unregister observer. Events won't be notified to this observer any longer.
        Parameters:
        obj - The observer

      • getServiceManager

        ServiceManager getServiceManager()
        Obtains the Service Manager for this instance of iServe
        Returns:
        the Service Manager

        Obtains the Document Manager for this instance of iServe

        Obtains the Service Transformation Engine for this instance
        Returns:
        the ServiceTransformationEngine

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        This method will be called when the server is being shutdown. Ensure a clean shutdown.

      • getSupportedInputMediaTypes

        Set<String> getSupportedInputMediaTypes()
        Obtains the list of supported media types the engine can import
        Returns:
        the Set of media types

      • canImport

        boolean canImport(String mediaType)
        Checks if the given media type can be imported
        Parameters:
        mediaType - the media type we wish to check if it can be imported
        Returns:
        true if it is supported or false otherwise.

      • getFilenameFilter

        FilenameFilter getFilenameFilter(String mediaType)
        Gets the corresponding filename filter to a given media type by checking both native formats and those supported through transformation
        Parameters:
        mediaType - the media type for which to obtain the file extension
        Returns:
        the filename filter or null if it is not supported. Callers are advised to check first that the media type is supported @see canTransform .

      • importServices

        List<URI> importServices(InputStream servicesContentStream,
                         String mediaType)
                  throws SalException
        Imports a new service within iServe. The original document is stored in the server and the transformed version registered within iServe.
        Parameters:
        servicesContentStream -
        mediaType -
        Returns:
        the List of URIs of the services imported
        Throws:
        SalException

      • importServices

        List<URI> importServices(URI servicesContentLocation,
                         String mediaType)
                  throws SalException
        Imports a new service from a remote description within iServe. The original document is stored in the server and the transformed version registered within iServe.
        Parameters:
        servicesContentLocation -
        mediaType -
        Returns:
        the List of URIs of the services imported
        Throws:
        SalException

      • clearRegistry

        boolean clearRegistry()
               throws SalException
        Clears the registry entirely: all documents and services are deleted This operation cannot be undone. Use with care.
        Returns:
        true if the registry was cleared.
        Throws:
        SalException

      • registerServices

        List<URI> registerServices(URI sourceDocumentUri,
                           String mediaType)
                    throws SalException
        Registers all the services found on a given source document. This operation takes care of performing the appropriate format transformation. The source document is not stored on the server. For keeping a copy of the source document within the server use @see importServices instead.
        Parameters:
        sourceDocumentUri -
        mediaType -
        Returns:
        the List of URIs of the services registered
        Throws:
        SalException

      • registerServices

        List<URI> registerServices(InputStream file,
                           String mediaType)
                    throws SalException
        Throws:
        SalException

      • unregisterService

        boolean unregisterService(URI serviceUri)
                   throws SalException
        Unregisters a service from the registry. Effectively this will delete the service description and remove any related documents on the server.
        Parameters:
        serviceUri - the URI of the service to unregister
        Returns:
        true if it was properly unregistered, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SalException

      • exportService

        String exportService(URI serviceUri,
                     String mediaType)
              throws ServiceException
        Exports a given service in the media type requested
        Parameters:
        serviceUri - the URI of the service to export
        mediaType - the media type to use for the export
        Returns:
        the String representation of the service in the given format
        Throws:
        ServiceException
